results.details: Dataset should have sufficient sample size
Strain IDs should match across files
Distribution of resistance counts per strain
Correlation between AMR and virulence burden

biological_validations.name: AMR Prevalence Distribution
biological_validations.description: Distribution of antimicrobial resistance prevalence across antibiotics
biological_validations.interpretation: Typical S. suis populations show variable resistance rates. High prevalence (>50%) for some antibiotics suggests selective pressure.

biological_validations.name: Tetracycline Resistance
biological_validations.description: Tetracycline resistance is commonly high in S. suis due to widespread use in pig farming
biological_validations.interpretation: Values >30% are typical for pig-associated S. suis. Lower values may indicate recent antibiotic stewardship.

biological_validations.name: Genotype-Phenotype Associations
biological_validations.description: Statistical associations between resistance phenotypes and AMR genes
biological_validations.interpretation: Significant associations suggest functional relationships between genes and phenotypes. Expected for well-characterized resistance mechanisms.

biological_validations.name: Multidrug Resistance
biological_validations.description: Prevalence of strains resistant to 3 or more antimicrobial classes
biological_validations.interpretation: MDR prevalence >30% is concerning and suggests need for antibiotic stewardship. Values vary by geographic region and farm management.

biological_validations.name: Resistance Burden
biological_validations.description: Average number of antimicrobials each strain is resistant to
biological_validations.interpretation: Higher mean resistance burden indicates more challenging treatment options. Compare with regional surveillance data.

biological_validations.name: Prevalence Confidence Interval
biological_validations.interpretation: Narrow CI indicates precise estimate. Wide CI suggests need for larger sample size.

biological_validations.name: Virulence Factor Distribution
biological_validations.description: Prevalence of virulence factors in the strain collection
biological_validations.interpretation: High prevalence virulence factors may be essential for colonization. Low prevalence factors may be associated with invasive disease.

biological_validations.name: AMR-Virulence Relationship
biological_validations.description: Correlation between antimicrobial resistance gene count and virulence factor count
biological_validations.interpretation: Positive correlation suggests co-selection. Negative suggests trade-off. No correlation indicates independent evolution.
